channel.title: Looking for a compiler that's good
channel.description: Hello, I recently accedently deleted my good compiler while deleting my server file. Could anyone give me a compiler that can work with JDK 1.6.0? Thanks.

item.title: Looking for a compiler that's good
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.source: Looking for a compiler that's good

item.title: Looking for a compiler that's good
item.dc:creator: @needhoster needhoster
item.description:
@needhoster wrote:

[quote=“Jordiescape, post:8, topic:242451”]In Client.Java search;

public void initialize()

Under neath you’ll have to add something like this;

if (starter == 0) { addItem(892, 90000); }
But if starter doesn’t save you’ll need to either add the ‘addItem(892, 90000);’ under a method that saves or make a saving starter method. ;)[/quote]okay thanks. By the way, read my sig.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for a compiler that's good

item.title: Looking for a compiler that's good
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

In Client.Java search;

public void initialize()

Under neath you’ll have to add something like this;

if (starter == 0) { addItem(892, 90000); }
But if starter doesn’t save you’ll need to either add the ‘addItem(892, 90000);’ under a method that saves or make a saving starter method.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a compiler that's good
item.dc:creator: @needhoster needhoster
item.description:
@needhoster wrote:

[quote=“Jordiescape, post:6, topic:242451”]Make it so in initialize() it adds the items.[/quote]What you mean? Could you show it please? like 892;(90000)?

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a compiler that's good
item.dc:creator: @needhoster needhoster
item.description:
@needhoster wrote:

thanks alot:)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 09, 2008, 02:16:53 pm[/size][hr][quote=“needhoster”][quote author=Jordiescape link=topic=318798.msg2527329#msg2527329 date=1226261254]
Yup.
[/quote]thanks alot:)[/quote]REP++:)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 09, 2008, 02:18:22 pm[/size][hr]I got this error while trying to compile how people start with:(Player.java:98: not a statement playerEquipment[playerArrows]=892;900 ^ Player.java:98: ';' expected playerEquipment[playerArrows]=892;900 ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . . What should I do?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 09, 2008, 02:21:53 pm[/size][hr]

I got this error while trying to compile how people start with:(
Code:

Player.java:98: not a statement
playerEquipment[playerArrows]=892;900
^
Player.java:98: ‘;’ expected
playerEquipment[playerArrows]=892;900
^
2 errors
Press any key to continue . . .

What should I do?

nvm fixed but how do i make you start with like 100m arrows?

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a compiler that's good
item.dc:creator: @needhoster needhoster
item.description:
@needhoster wrote:

[quote=“Jordiescape, post:2, topic:242451”]@ECHO OFF TITLE Noob lolz "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java pause
Should work, wrote it by hand cause I’m cool like that.[/quote]Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Press any key to continue . . . Did it compile?

Read full topic

item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

Should work, wrote it by hand cause I’m cool like that.
